connector.description: Send and receive messages to/from and IRC chat.

camel.sink.path.hostname.name: camel.sink.path.hostname
camel.sink.path.hostname.description: Hostname for the IRC chat server

camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: Port number for the IRC chat server. If no port is configured then a default port of either 6667, 6668 or 6669 is used.

camel.sink.endpoint.autoRejoin.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoRejoin
camel.sink.endpoint.autoRejoin.description: Whether to auto re-join when being kicked

camel.sink.endpoint.channels.name: camel.sink.endpoint.channels
camel.sink.endpoint.channels.description: Comma separated list of IRC channels.

camel.sink.endpoint.commandTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.commandTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.commandTimeout.description: Delay in milliseconds before sending commands after the connection is established.

camel.sink.endpoint.keys.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keys
camel.sink.endpoint.keys.description: Comma separated list of keys for channels.

camel.sink.endpoint.namesOnJoin.name: camel.sink.endpoint.namesOnJoin
camel.sink.endpoint.namesOnJoin.description: Sends NAMES command to channel after joining it. onReply has to be true in order to process the result which will have the header value irc.num = '353'.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.colors.name: camel.sink.endpoint.colors
camel.sink.endpoint.colors.description: Whether or not the server supports color codes.

camel.sink.endpoint.onReply.name: camel.sink.endpoint.onReply
camel.sink.endpoint.onReply.description: Whether or not to handle general responses to commands or informational messages.

camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters
camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters.description: Used for configuring security using SSL. Reference to a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. This reference overrides any configured SSLContextParameters at the component level. Note that this setting overrides the trustManager option.

camel.sink.endpoint.trustManager.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustManager
camel.sink.endpoint.trustManager.description: The trust manager used to verify the SSL server's certificate.

camel.component.irc.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.irc.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.irc.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.irc.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.irc.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.irc.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.irc.useGlobalSslContextP.name: camel.component.irc.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.irc.useGlobalSslContextP.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
